channel.title: Ags causes cmd error?

item.title: Ags causes cmd error?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Change the emote to an emote that actually works, and see if you still get the error. If you don’t, you’ll know it’s the emote causing the problem and something in there is crashing the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Ags causes cmd error?
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

Pi 377

When i ags spec a person or npc it gives me cmd errors.

it only gives that 1-2 lines… The extra errors are me clicking it over and over again.

heres the code

case 11694: // ags
c.startAnimation(4304);
c.specDamage = 1.40; <-- i removed that and it made a diffrent error. single lines then 2. and so on… ughghghg
c.specAccuracy = 2.50;
c.gfx0(1222);
c.hitDelay = getHitDelay(c.getItems().getItemName(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]).toLowerCase());
c.forcedText = “”;
c.forcedChatUpdateRequired = true;
c.updateRequired = true;
break;

heres client ags anim code

if(j == 4304) { //AGS special emote
int file = 1834;
if(FrameStart[file] < 1)
Class36.methodCustomAnimations(false, file);
int[] frames = {136,137,138,139,140,141,142,143,144,145,146,147,148,149,150,151,152,153,154,155,156,157,158,159,160,161,162,163,164,165,166,0};
anims[j].anInt352 = frames.length-1;
anims[j].anIntArray353 = new int[frames.length-1];
anims[j].anIntArray354 = new int[frames.length-1];
anims[j].anIntArray355 = new int[frames.length-1];
for(int i2 = 0; i2 < frames.length-1; i2++) {
anims[j].anIntArray353[i2] = frames[i2]+FrameStart[file];
anims[j].anIntArray354[i2] = -1;
anims[j].anIntArray355[i2] = 0;
}
}
